title: Sr Quality Assurance Engineer - Advanced English
description:
Muito prazer, somos a Zallpy! Somos muito mais que uma empresa de tecnologia;
somos uma comunidade diversa, plural e talentosa. Nosso propósito é liderar a transformação digital, com excelência e agilidade, promovendo crescimento mútuo e genuíno em relações éticas e duradouras. Flexibilidade é uma de nossas marcas registradas, atuamos em diferentes modelos e formatos de equipe, mantendo nossa cultura leve, colaborativa e integrada, proporcionando equidade de oportunidades em um espaço onde todos se sintam seguros e ouvidos.Principais Atividades:
Projetar, implementar e manter testes manuais e automatizados, assegurando escalabilidade e consistência no processo de QA.Garantir a execução de um processo de manutenção ativa de código de testes automatizado.Participar ativamente das cerimônias ágeis (planning, refinamento, dailies, reviews).Especificar e executar testes funcionais, não-funcionais, regressivos, exploratórios e de integração.Produzir relatórios de qualidade, incluindo cobertura de testes, resultados de execução e métricas de performance, para acompanhamento de stakeholders.Realizar a gestão de métricas de Qualidade e de análise de causa-raiz.Realizar análise de requisitos e critérios de aceitação junto ao PO/analista de negócios.Atuar de forma contínua durante o ciclo de desenvolvimento, identificando e prevenindo falhas de qualidade desde as fases iniciais.Realizar a gestão de defeitos.Apoiar a construção de ambientes de testes.Contribuir para a definição da estratégia de testes da equipe.Orientar membros da equipe de QA, promovendo boas práticas e uma cultura de melhoria contínua.Selecionar, configurar e gerenciar ferramentas de automação, sistemas de gerenciamento de testes e rastreamento de defeitos para otimizar a eficiência do time.Documentar funcionalidades e processos de Qualidade.Requisitos:
Experiência sólida em testes manuais e automatizados.Experiência sólida em ferramentas de gestão de testes, como Qase, Zephyr, Xray etc.Experiência sólida em ferramentas como Jira, ClickUp ou Azure DevOps.Experiência sólida em ferramentas colaborativas de documentação.Conhecimento em ferramentas como Appium, Selenium, Cypress, Playwright ou similares.Experiência com testes de APIs (Postman, Swagger, REST Assured, Newman).Familiaridade com Git, pipelines de CI/CD e versionamento de código.Conhecimento em BDD, TDD e boas práticas de QA.Capacidade de escrever scripts de testes em linguagens como JavaScript, Python, Ruby, C# ou Java.Desejável:
conhecimento em testes de performance (JMeter, k6), segurança e mobile.Perfil proativo e orientado à qualidade.Boa comunicação com time técnico e stakeholders.Capacidade de trabalhar com autonomia e senso de prioridade.Olhar crítico para melhoria contínua de processos e produtos.Espírito colaborativo e foco em resultado.Inglês avançado para atuação em projeto Internacional.Diferencias:
Experiência com testes de aplicativos desenvolvidos em .NET MAUI (mobile multiplataforma).Experiência em ambientes cloud (Azure).Certificação ISTQB® CTFL.O que oferecemos:
Vale Alimentação/Refeição:
Utilizamos o cartão multibenefício EVA, em formato crédito, para proporcionar flexibilidade nas suas compras diárias.* Plano de Saúde Unimed:
Sem coparticipação ou carência para o titular. Dependentes como filhos, cônjuges ou enteados podem ser incluídos com coparticipação.*

title: Senior Research Engineer
description: We are currently seeking a Research Engineer who will join our client. We are seeking a passionate developer who has experience in NLP/CV and was previously working on AI projects.If you're someone who combines deep technical expertise with a passion for building innovative solutions, this is the role for you. Apply now!Your tasksDeveloping modern software in the entire software development lifecycle, building, testing, and delivering high-quality solutionsBuilding scalable ML Solutions and creating large-scale data processing pipelines to help researchers build and train novel machine learning algorithmsDeveloping high-performing, scalable systems in the context of large online delivery environmentsWorking in a collaborative team-oriented environmentCooperating in an agile environmentTrying new approaches and learning new technologies. You will contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveriesCommunicating through dynamic engagement and communication with cross-functional partners and team membersRequirementsA Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Related Field, or Equivalent ExperienceAt least 5 years of software engineering experience, with a minimum of 2 years focused on Machine Learning products or solutions and 1 year specifically in Natural Language Processing (NLP) tasks such as Named Entity Recognition (NER), Document Analysis and Classification, Information Extraction, and Information RetrievalDeep understanding of Python software development stacks and ecosystemsExperienced in pairing with research scientists for running experiments and evaluationKeen interest in the application of the latest trends in AI/ML for real-world applications Proven experience in developing cloud-based applications and applying CI/CD, DevOps, and SDLC methodologies throughout the development lifecycle

title: Engenheiro Devops Senior
description:
Netvagas Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, BrazilEngenheiro devops seniorNetvagas Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, BrazilVocê quer fazer parte de uma empresa de tecnologia que está há mais de 20 anos no mercado, que não apenas é parceira premier do Google Cloud, mas também já foi 4 vezes premiada como Partner of the year? Uma empresa que além de ser fera naquilo que faz, também valoriza e leva a sério o compromisso com cada IPNETER, possuindo há 5 anos consecutivos o selo Great Place To Work.Pois é, essa empresa existe. Essa empresa é a IPNET!Além disso, somos comprometidos com a inclusão, abraçando cada forma única de ser humano, independente de etnia, gênero, orientação sexual, idade, habilidades físicas ou mentais. Por isso, todas as nossas vagas são inclusivas. Aqui, não apenas reconhecemos, mas também celebramos as diferentes identidades, experiências e talentos de cada pessoa que faz parte do nosso time.E, Estamos Com Uma Vaga Aberta Para Engenheiro De DevOps Sênior, Que Irá Atuar Dentro Do Nosso Time De Delivery Team, Sendo Responsável PorCriar, configurar e gerenciar ambientes em nuvem utilizando AWS, Azure ou Google Cloud. Isso inclui a configuração de servidores, redes, bancos de dados, auto escalabilidade e balanceamento de carga;
Utilizar ferramentas e scripts para automatizar a implantação de aplicações, monitoramento, backup e recuperação. Implementar integração contínua (CI) e entrega contínua (CD) usando ferramentas como Jenkins, GitLab CI ou CircleCI;
Facilitar a colaboraçãoentre desenvolvedores, operações de TI e outros profissionais, coordenando esforços para garantir a entrega rápida e confiável dos serviços;
Monitorar o desempenho dos sistemas em nuvem, identificar gargalos e garantir a escalabilidade dos serviços. Utilizar ferramentas de monitoramento para obter informações em tempo real, identificar problemas e implementar soluções proativas;
Trabalhar com equipes de segurança para garantir a segurança e conformidade da infraestrutura em nuvem. Implementar medidas de segurança como firewalls, criptografia e autenticação, além de gerenciar a proteção de dados sensíveis;
Desenvolver habilidadesavançadas em automação utilizando Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Terraform ou similares. Escrever scripts complexos e criar pipelines automatizados para implantação e gerenciamento de infraestrutura;
Manter documentação completa e atualizada dos sistemas, processos e configurações;
Entendemos que para atender as demandas da vaga, é necessário que o candidato possua:
Bacharelado em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia de Software ou área relacionada;
Conhecimento emscripts e automação (Python, Bash, etc.);
Experiência comgerenciamento de infraestrutura como código (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation);
;
Conhecimento em contêineres e orquestração (Docker, Kubernetes);
Experiência comferramentas de monitoramento e logging (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, Splunk);
CI/CD avançado (Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI, etc.);
Arquitetura de Cloud (preferencialmente Google Cloud Platform);
Implementação de Infraestrutura:
Projetar, implementar e gerenciar a infraestrutura de TI usando ferramentas de automação como Terraform, Ansible, ou CloudFormation;
Conhecimento avançado de redes e segurança;
Experiência commetodologias ágeis;
Conhecimento empráticasde segurança DevOps (DevSecOps).Experiência em projetos de grande escala e ambientes de alta disponibilidade.Certificações em AWS, Azure, ou Google Cloud.Na IPNET, acreditamos no trabalho híbrido como forma de fortalecer nossa cultura e acelerar nosso engajamento, respeitando, ao mesmo tempo, a flexibilidade. Por essa razão, nossa proposta consiste em trabalhar 2X na semana home-office e 3X presencialmente no escritório. Atualmente, contamos com dois escritórios no Brasil:

etapas de entrevistas com atração & seleção, gestão imediata e gestão sênior.Sobre a empresaSomos a V.Tal, uma empresa dedicada a viabilizar a conexão com o mundo digital, transformando a vida das pessoas. Nosso objetivo é incluir o Brasil no topo dos países mais digitalizados, promovendo inclusão digital, novos negócios e desenvolvimento regional.Contamos com a maior rede de fibra ótica do Brasil e uma equipe de alta performance, trabalhando com uma rede neutra, compartilhada com operadoras, provedores e parceiros de diversas regiões.Nossa cultura valoriza a colaboração, confiança, busca por soluções, aprendizado contínuo, excelência, alta performance, ambiente saudável e inovação.Se você se identifica com nossa proposta, venha construir o futuro conosco!Acompanhe nossas novidades#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Engineering Manager, Managed Services
description:
Join or sign in to find your next jobJoin to apply for the Engineering Manager, Managed Services role at Canonical1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the Engineering Manager, Managed Services role at CanonicalCanonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.We are hiring an Engineering Manager ...This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you'll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a Cloud Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.Location:
This is a globally remote role.The role entailsManage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operationsIdentify and measure team health indicatorsImplement disciplined engineering and operations processesRepresent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teamsEnsure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverablesWork to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globeDeliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely mannerWhat we are looking for in youBachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology fieldProven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teamsProven experience with OpenStackDemonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code qualityExperience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plusStrong communication and cooperation skillsExperience with agile software development methodologiesExperience working in and managing distributed teamsTechnical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systemsExperience with cloud topologies and technologiesTravel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or lessWhat we offer colleaguesWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in personPersonal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per yearAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveMaternity and paternity leaveTeam Member Assistance Program & Wellness PlatformOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleaguesPriority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence;
in order to succeed, weneed to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.Seniority levelSeniority levelMid-Senior levelEmployment typeEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionJob functionManagement and ManufacturingIndustriesSoftware DevelopmentReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at Canonical by 2xWe’re unlocking community knowledge in a new way. title: Staff Site Reliability Engineer - Work From Home
description:
Staff Site Reliability Engineer - Work from homeStaff Site Reliability Engineer - Work from home4 days ago Be among the first 25 applicantsGet AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features. Join our close-knit LATAM remote team:
Connect through fun activities like coffee breaks, tech talks, and games with your team-mates and management. Say goodbye to micromanagement! We champion autonomy, open communication, and respect for diversity as our core values.️Your well-being matters:
Our People Care team is here from day one to support you with everything from time-off requests to wellness check-ins.Plus, our Accounts Management team ensures smooth, effective client relationships, so you can focus on what you do best.Ready to grow with us? Here’s what we offer you by joining us! Competitive USD salary – We value your skills and contributions! 100% remote work – While you can work from anywhere, you’re always welcome to connect with teammates and grow your network at our coworking spaces across LATAM! Paid time off – Take the time you need according to your country’s regulations, all while receiving your full salary. Rest, recharge, and come back stronger! National Holidays celebrated – Take time off to celebrate important events and traditions with loved ones, fully embracing your culture. Sick leave – Focus on your health without the stress. Take the necessary time to recover and feel better. Refundable Annual Credit – Spend it on the perks you love to enhance your work-life balance! Team-building activities – Join us for coffee breaks, tech talks, and after-work gatherings to bond with your Nearsure family and feel part of our vibrant community. Birthday day off – Enjoy an extra day off during your birthday week to celebrate in style with friends and family!About the project:
As a Staff Site Reliability Engineer, you will own and optimize OpenTelemetry pipelines, enabling scalable and efficient observability. You’ll build tools that empower teams, support incident response, and drive best practices. Your work ensures a reliable, secure infrastructure and actionable alerting across the organization.How your day-to-day work will look like Design, implement, and maintain observability pipelines across the three main signals—logs, metrics, and traces—ensuring standardized, scalable, and efficient data ingestion. Optimize ingestion strategies to balance cost, performance, and usability. Build self-service automation and tooling that enables development teams to instrument and leverage observability without requiring manual intervention from the SRE team. Drive adoption of best practices while ensuring teams own their telemetry. Design the processes, playbooks, checklists, and automations for them and other engineers to follow during an incident. Interact with members from almost all teams across the business to understand their monitoring, alerting, and SLO / SLA requirements and design systems and processes that ensure we meet or exceed these requirements. Influence architectural decisions during initial design stages to ensure resiliency and scale at the outset of software development. Design the processes, playbooks, checklists, and automations for them and other engineers to follow during an incident. Leverage Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) to provision and manage monitoring tools, alerting rules, and our observability configurations across OTEL Pipelines. Design base-level requirements for new and existing services to ensure that all client infrastructure and code are monitored consistently and accurately at a basic level. Take full ownership of client infrastructure reliability, ensuring adherence to key availability and security KPIs.This would make you the ideal candidate Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 8+ Years of experience working as an SRE Engineer or in a very similar role, more focused on observability. 5+ Years of experience working with cloud (AWS). 5+ Years of experience working with IaC tools (Terraform) and GitOps CI/CD solutions (ArgoCD, GitHub Actions, or similar). 4+ Years of experience working with monitoring and logging tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, Loki, New Relic, or Datadog (experience managing observability pipelines at scale in high-throughput environments). 4+ Years of experience working in Kubernetes, including its core components, deployment methodologies, and monitoring best practices. Strong communication skills with team members and stakeholders (technical and nontechnical communication). Strong scripting abilities (Python, Go, or similar) for automating observability tasks.Experience integrating incident management platforms (PagerDuty, Jira) with automated alerting workflows. Advanced English Level is required for this role as you will work with US clients. Effective communication in English is essential to deliver the best solutions to our clients and expand your horizons.What to expect from our hiring process1. Let’s chat about your experience!2. Impress our recruiters, and you’ll move on to a technical interview with our top developers.3. Nail that, and you’ll meet our client - your final step to joining our amazing team! At Nearsure, we’re dedicated to solving complex business challenges through cutting-edge technology and we believe in the power of tailored solutions. Whether you are passionate about transforming businesses with Generative AI, building innovative software products, or implementing comprehensive enterprise platform solutions, we invite you to be part of our dynamic team!We would love to hear from you if you are eager to make an impact and join a collaborative team that values creativity and expertise.Let’s work together to shape the future of technology!By applying to this position, you authorize Nearsure to collect, store, transfer, and process your personal data in accordance with our Privacy Policy. For more information, please review our Privacy Policy. title: Engenheiro Mecânico Sr.
description:
Construindo sobre nosso passado. Prontos para o futuroA Worley é uma empresa global de serviços profissionais composta por especialistas em energia, produtos químicos e recursos. Estabelecemos parcerias com clientes para entregar projetos e criar valor ao longo da vida de seus ativos. Estamos a unir dois mundos, avançando em direção a fontes de energia mais sustentáveis, ao mesmo tempo que ajudamos a fornecer a energia, os produtos químicos e os recursos necessários agora.Seja qual for a sua ambição, há um caminho para você aqui. E não há barreira para o seu potencial sucesso profissional. Junte-se a nós para ampliar seus horizontes, explorar diversas oportunidades e fazer parte da implementação de mudanças sustentáveis. Para obter mais informações, visite Worley.ComEstamos buscando para nosso Banco de Talentos um(a) Engenheiro Mecânico Sr. para um de nossos projetos em prospecção, com foco em engenharia executiva e detalhada para projetos de óleo & gás (refinarias).ResponsabilidadesFormado em Engenharia Mecânica (CREA Ativo)Atuar em todas as fases do projeto de engenharia, com foco em projetos executivos e detalhados;
Garantir que osdocumentos e entregáveis estejam em conformidade com os requisitos do cliente e padrões da empresa;
Elaborar, revisar e validar documentações técnicas;
Colaborar com outras disciplinas para integração de soluções;
Fornecer suporte técnico em reuniões de projeto, revisões e interfaces com o cliente;
Apoiar a equipede construção e comissionamento quando aplicável.RequisitosFormação acadêmica em Engenharia Mecânica (CREA Ativo)Experiência comprovada em projetos de engenharia detalhada e executiva em refinarias;
Atuação em empresas do segmento de óleo & gás;
Conhecimento das normastécnicas e boas práticas aplicáveis à sua disciplina;
Inglês intermediário (com foco em leitura técnica);
Domínio do pacote Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint);
Domínio de ferramentas e softwares específicos da disciplina;
Excelente relação interpessoal e capacidade de trabalho em equipe multidisciplinar;
Experiência em ambientede alta criticidade e conformidade com SMS/QSMS.Localidade:
Rio de Janeiro, RJ (Presencial)Avançando juntosEstamos empenhados em construir um local de trabalho diversificado, inclusivo e respeitoso, onde todos sintam que pertencem, possam falar e sejam ouvidos.Estamos construindo um local de trabalho diversificado, inclusivo e respeitoso. title: Aprendiz De Engenharia Civil | Zona Norte Rj
description:
O grupo Direcional faz a diferença na vida de milhares de pessoas. Para seguir cumprindo seu propósito, temos um time formado por profissionais brilhantes, com o mesmo objetivo, e você pode ser o próximo talento a integrar nossa equipe, que hoje é referência no mercado.ResponsabilidadesRealizar o acompanhamento da execução dos trabalhos em diferentes frentes de serviço no canteiro de obras;
Atuar na elaboração de relatórios;
Participar do levantamento e leitura de projetos;
Auxiliar na elaboração do diário de obra;
Atuar na realização de pedido e programação de material;
Apoiar na gestão de controle de qualidade;
Participar ativamente das demais atividades relacionadas ao acompanhamento de obras sob a supervisão do engenheiro.RequisitosTer entre 18 e 21 anos de idade;

Ter bons conhecimentos em Excel;
Vontade de se tornar umprofissional diferenciado no mercado da construção Civil.BenefíciosVale alimentação;
SOBRE O GRUPO DIRECIONALHá 43 anos, a Direcional constrói o sonho de milhares de famílias com responsabilidade, qualidade e, principalmente, compromisso. Sempre com um empreendimento pensado para cada perfil, buscamos valorizar os condomínios com projetos modernos e funcionais, desenvolvidos para superar as expectativas de diversas famílias e, mais do que isso, para realizar o sonho da casa própria.Em 2020, nossa família cresceu com o lançamento da Riva Incorporadora. Pertencente ao Grupo Direcional, a Riva já chegou ao mercado com toda robustez e excelência da Companhia. title: Staff Back-End Engineer (South America)
description:
Join to apply for the Staff Back-End Engineer (South America) role at Varsity Tutors, a Nerdy Company1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the Staff Back-End Engineer (South America) role at Varsity Tutors, a Nerdy CompanyGet AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.Overview:
We are looking for a Back-End Staff Software Engineer (Full-Time Contractor) based in South America to join us on our mission to help people learn!Overview:
We are looking for a Back-End Staff Software Engineer (Full-Time Contractor) based in South America to join us on our mission to help people learn!This is a great opportunity to work with an amazing team and drive the technology of learning products and platforms. We operate in a highly collaborative environment with Product and Design to build experiences that matter to our customers. At Nerdy, engineers do not just write code;
they actively participate in the conversation on what and how to build the systems and solutions that matter to our customers. If you love your customers as much as we do, we'd love to hear from you.The Staff Engineer will assume a dual role as a technical leader and a visionary for our highly complex and high-performing systems. In this capacity, they will not only provide technical guidance and mentorship to the team but also play a pivotal role in shaping and driving the overarching vision of our system.About Nerdy:
At Nerdy (NYSE:
NRDY) - the company behind Varsity Tutors - we're redrawing the blueprint of learning. Our Live + AI platform fuses real-time human expertise with proprietary generative-AI systems, setting a new bar for measurable academic impact at global scale. We recruit the kind of technologists and operators you'd bet on as solo founders - people who turn ambiguous problems into shipping code, iterate faster than markets move, and compound their advantage with every data point. In an era where great employees can deliver 10-times the leverage of the merely good, we back those who play to win.Fortune favors the bold. Join us.How we compete:
AI-Native at every level From the CEO to day-one hires, everyone builds and ships with generative AI. If you're not wielding AI, you're not done.Entrepreneurial velocity Move at founder speed, prototype in hours, and measure in real user outcomes. Slow teams die.Free-market rigor Ideas rise or fall on merit and results - no committees, no politics, no cap on upside.Full-stack ownership You design, build, and run what you ship;
accountability is a feature, not a bug.Reward for contribution Pay rises with impact, not years. Outstanding results earn outsized rewards. We evaluate both what you achieve and how you achieve it:
living our leadership principles and using AI effectively are formally measured and rewarded.Relentless exploration Push the frontier of generative AI in live learning and - because only the paranoid survive - questioning every legacy assumption along the way.Is Apolitical You stay focused on mission-aligned outcomes, not distractions or unrelated causes.If you're a technically minded builder who thrives on open competition, personal responsibility, and the chance to redefine how the world learns - while continually stretching the limits of what generative AI can do - come do the most ambitious and rewarding work of your career here. Learn more at nerdy.Com.Nerdy's shareholder letters below explain our latest products and strategy:
Q1-2025 Shareholder LetterQ4-2024 Shareholder LetterQ3-2024 Shareholder LetterResponsibilitiesTechnical Leadership:
Serve as the technical point of reference for the squad and broader engineering team, ensuring best practices and architectural standards are upheld.Solution Design:
Lead the design and architectural discussions, making pivotal decisions on technologies, frameworks, and design patterns.Code Quality:
Advocate for and ensure the delivery of high-quality, maintainable, and scalable code. Conduct regular code reviews and provide mentorship to team members.Collaboration:
Work closely with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements, provide technical insights, and ensure the timely delivery of features.Strategy and Vision:
Contribute to the engineering department's strategy and vision, bringing innovative ideas to improve our customer-facing experiences.Problem Solving:
Address complex technical challenges, innovate solutions, and optimize existing systems for scalability and performance.Team Development:
Mentor and develop team members, helping them to grow in their technical roles and careers.Qualifications:
Minimum of 10 years of software engineering experience with a proven track record of working on complex systems.Strong experience with Ruby. Go and Pyton are nice to have!Explicit mentoring of senior-level engineers regularly, leading to results.Significant experience in AWS based cloud architecture environments.In-depth knowledge of modern software engineering practices, design patterns, and architectures.Ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Demonstrated experience in collaborating with multidisciplinary teams.Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.A strong owner willing to roll up their sleeves. This role includes coding and reviewing the code of others.Ability to implement customer-facing solutions that solve the customers' true needs.Nerdy is an apolitical company focused solely on helping people learn, and we achieve the most when united in this mission.Unlock Your Full Potential at Nerdy:
Join our worldwide team—work from home, get great pay, and help shape the future of learning. Here's what you get:
Competitive USD Compensation:
Enjoy a market-leading rate paid in U.S. dollars.100% Remote (Home Country Only):
Work from anywhere in your home country—no relocation required, no borders crossed.Flexible Time Off:
Our flexible PTO lets you recharge on your own terms and when you need it the most.Local Holiday Pay:
We honor your nation's official holidays with paid time off—celebrate what matters to you.Continuous Learning:
Get a free, all-inclusive learning membership for you and your household—including 1-on-1 tutoring hours, unlimited on-demand classes, and access to our full suite of learning products and services.Supercharge with AI:
Gain exclusive access to cutting-edge AI tools that boost your productivity, making you feel almost super-human (cape not included).Feedback-Rich, Collaborative Culture:
Tap into regular training, peer reviews, and a team that treats every team member as a vital collaborator and owner in our success.Make a Global Impact:
Your expertise fuels an innovative platform used by learners around the world—be part of something transformative.The Bottom Line:
If you're driven by impact, energized by ownership, and excited to help shape what's next, you'll thrive here. We move fast, think big, and reward those who deliver. This isn't a traditional corporate environment - it's a place to do the most meaningful work of your career.Seniority levelSeniority levelMid-Senior levelEmployment typeEmployment typeContractJob functionJob functionEngineering and Information TechnologyIndustriesTechnology, Information and InternetReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at Varsity Tutors, a Nerdy Company by 2xSoftware Engineer, Early Career (For Women in Tech Candidates)We’re unlocking community knowledge in a new way. Experts add insights directly into each article, started with the help of AI.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Senior System Engineer
description:
Do you enjoy working with multiple teams to ensure on-time delivery?Would you like the opportunity to develop your career within a global energy company?Be part of a successful teamWe are a leader in flexible line construction and production. Our innovative physical and digital solutions increase efficiency, production and maximize reservoir value.Join our teamAs a Senior Systems Engineer, you will work and act as a leader in a team to develop and support products within the Technology and Project's groups. You will perform scientific and engineering efforts and coordinate other engineers in task related to the design of new products and services, as well as new designs for customer projects. You will deliver projects through the stages of design, verification and production.As Senior Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for:
Controlling Scope and daily tasks with expertise and in alignment to project and tender schedule.Planning tasks and coordinating a multidisciplinary engineering team and capturing their skill sets to best serve the qualification programs' task.Promoting good communication across different stakeholders and engineering disciplines.Showing and carrying constant work organization tightness.Working collaborative with a global engineering community.Communicating with Customers in both Portuguese and English language ensuring customer satisfaction and participation in the tender or project process.Developing Project deliverables, reviewing and approving the work of others, such as but not limited to manufacturing drawings, schematics, P&IDs, procedures, reports, etc.Fuel your passionTo be successful in this role you will:
Bachelor’s in mechanical, Electrical or other Engineering bachelors is required.Have experience with Subsea Project/Product Engineer background at component level, including large and small-bore valves & actuators, large bore connections, metal and elastomeric seals, mechanical locking systems and others. Emphasis required on pre-salt and deepwater systems.Proficiency in communicating with Customers in both Portuguese and English language.Experience with PETROBRAS Qualification Projects requiredBackground in leading and coordinating cost-out exercises is paramount.A Solution, Cost and Schedule driven mindset.Proactiveness and engagement to cover daily tasks.Quick learning and resilience skill sets to a changing scenario.Ability to work and/or support more than two NPIs running in parallel.Availability to travel and support work fronts in different locations in the globe.DesirableSkilled in Engineering Database set up and configuration (SAP or Team Center);
Skilled in Engineering based software’s (Autocad, Creo, Solid Works, Visio, MSP)Masters or Pos-graduate in Engineering.Work in a way that works for youWe recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:
Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productiveLocation:
Rio de Janeiro – ReticWorking with usOur people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.Working for youOur inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:
Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activitiesComprehensive private medical care optionsSafety net of life insurance and disability programsTailored financial programsAdditional elected or voluntary benefitsAbout UsWith operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.Join UsAre you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!A Baker Hughes Company prioriza oportunidades iguais para todos os candidatos. Todas as nossas vagas são destinadas também a pessoas portadoras de deficiência. We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.Join Us:
Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.R147606Duque de Caxias, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil R$6,400.00-R$6,400.00 2 weeks agoRio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil 1 week agoGreater Rio de Janeiro R$9,001.00-R$10,000.00 3 weeks agoRio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil 3 days agoRio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil 3 days agoRio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil 1 month agoRio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil 1 week agoRio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil 3 hours agoRio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil 5 days agoQuer fazer parte do time Origem Energia? a aquisição da casa própria.Somos apaixonados pelo que fazemos, seja na cadeia produtiva ou na comercialização dos empreendimentos.Gostou? Prazer, somos a Cury, venha fazer parte da nossa história!Conheça as nossas etapas do processo seletivo:

essas etapas podem sofrer alterações de acordo com a necessidade da vaga.Ah... pessoas com deficiências são super bem-vindas viu?Acredita que não preenche todos os requisitos?Um estudo recente do LinkedIn indicou que mulheres são menos propensas a se candidatarem a vagas se não acreditarem que preenchem 100% das qualificações. Em comparação, homens tendem a se inscrever mesmo atendendo 60%. Aqui na Cury, queremos construir um ambiente de trabalho cada vez mais diversos e inclusivo. title: Principal Umbilicals Engineer
description:
Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:
TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry. Our ambition is to build a sustainable future through relentless innovation and global collaboration – and we want you to be part of it. You’ll be joining a culture that values curiosity, expertise, and ideas as well as diversity, inclusion, and authenticity. Bring your unique energy to our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide, and discover a rewarding, fulfilling, and varied career that you can take in anywhere you want to go.Job PurposeResponsible for the technical package management on dedicated projects and mentorship across the umbilical engineering department. Responsible for the management of high impact topics across all live projects and provide technical support and guidance at a project technical leadership level with support of the lead engineer where required. Responsible for the content and quality of umbilical engineering activities including management and co-ordination of task related improvements and level 3 / level 4 obeya.Job DescriptionAt technical authority level, provide support to Post Award teams throughout the life cycle of the project. Including but not limited to supporting:
Strategy setting at project kick-offTechnical risk identification, reviews, communication to PMA and closureDesign rule and project concessionsApproval status of for any umbilical engineering assessment within design rule limits and umbilical cross section designs.Management and close out of technical topics and work with other leads to ensure balance and support across the wider department.Responsible for development and integration of new technologies, templates, calculations and tools to improve efficiency and quality.On job training and mentorship of engineers at all levels within the PMA.Working with Pre-award team, ensure a smooth handover of tender and feed projects to contract award.Drive Company initiatives with the umbilical team in conjunction with other leads and Post Award Engineering ManagerWhere appropriate and as directed, take actions to comply with the group expectations to meet the code of experts’ requirement.You are meant for this job if:
Degree or equivalent in an Engineering discipline – preferably Mechanical Engineering, Subsea Engineering.Relevant experience of the offshore industry and in the detailed design of umbilical systems orengineering background with experience of the offshore industry and in the detailed design of umbilical systems. Or general engineering background with relevant experience of the offshore industry and in the detailed design of umbilical systems.Vast knowledge of industry standards relating to umbilical design and subsea industry.Significant experience problem solving and working in high pace environmentsProficient in software such as OrcaflexProficient in Microsoft office tool such as word, excel and PowerPointExperience delivering against challenging schedules in a project management environment is essential.Experience within Dynamic Inter-Array CablesExperience leading a team and effective workload managementExperience with engineering tool such as MathCAD or equivalent.Experience in design tool is not required but beneficial, such as:
AutoCAD, InventorExperience in Finite Element Analysis Tools is not required but beneficial, such as:
Ansys, Abaqus, Orcaflex.Experience with Lean practices and has a drive for improvementsExperience with Design for Safety and high quality practicesWhat we offerMy Annual Leave - 25days + 8fixed public holidays.My Wealth and Protection – Critical Illness Cover, Income Protection, Life Assurance, Will Writing, Workplace Isa, Group Personal Pension Plan - employer contributions up to 10%.My Health and Wellbeing - Private Medical Insurance, Employee Assistance Programme, Dental Insurance, Health Assessments & Personal Accident Insurance.My Lifestyle - Electric Vehicle Scheme, Cyle2Work, Employee Tech Scheme, Give as You Earn, GymFlex, Holiday Trading, Personal Travel Insurance, Perks at Work.My Workplace - Subsidised Cafe, Branded workwear, Hybrid Working, Flexible Working Arrangements, Enhanced Maternity and Parental leave, Talent/Management and Leadership programmes, Various inhouse training opportunities for your personal development.My Giving - Volunteering opportunitiesBeing a global leader in the energy industry requires an inclusive and diverse environment. TechnipFMC promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion by ensuring equal opportunities to all ages, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations, gender expressions, disabilities, or all other pluralities. We celebrate who you are and what you bring. Every voice matters and we encourage you to add to our culture.TechnipFMC respects the rights and dignity of those it works with and promotes adherence to internationally recognized human rights principles for those in its value chain.Learnmore about TechnipFMCand find other open positions by visiting ourCareer Page.Follow us onLinkedInfor company updates.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: React Native Mobile Engineer
description:
Join to apply for the Mobile Engineer role at Braintrust1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the Mobile Engineer role at BraintrustAbout PYYNE DigitalJob DescriptionAbout PYYNE DigitalPYYNE is a modern technology consultancy engineering the next generation of digital products and services.At PYYNE, we believe in using technology to unlock business potential, create sustainable growth, and drive forward digital excellence. Our solutions range from advanced Software Engineering, Cloud, and Data & AI solutions.Job SummaryPYYNE is seeking a Mobile Engineer to build a greenfield MVP mobile application. This is a full-stack mobile engineering role focused on rapid development, real-time interactivity, and responsive user experiences.You'll work closely with our Tech Lead to architect, build, and refine a high-quality, scalable app from the ground up. This position is ideal for a developer who thrives in fast-paced environments and enjoys solving complex problems with clean, maintainable code.Key ResponsibilitiesApp Development:
Design, build, and deploy a performant cross-platform mobile app using React Native and TypeScript.Implement UI components using Shadcn and follow responsive, mobile-first design principles.Handle real-time interactions via WebSockets, Socket.IO, or GraphQL subscriptions.API & Data Integration:
Connect front-end components to REST or GraphQL APIs for dynamic content and real-time updates.Collaborate with backend engineers to define API specs and optimize data flows.Testing & Deployment:
Write and maintain automated tests using Jest and React Testing Library.Set up and manage basic CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions and Docker.Assist with publishing to Play Store and App Store (experience is a plus, but not required).Collaboration & Innovation:
Work with product and UX/UI designers to implement sleek, intuitive interfaces.Leverage AI tools like Cursor, GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, or Gemini to accelerate development.Participate in agile planning, code reviews, and sprint retrospectives.QualificationsRequired Skills:
Strong experience with React Native and TypeScript.UI/UX sensibility with experience building user-friendly, visually engaging interfaces.Hands-on knowledge of real-time data handling (e.G., WebSockets or GraphQL subscriptions).Familiarity with REST or GraphQL API integration.Proficiency in automated testing with Jest and React Testing Library.Working knowledge of Docker, CI/CD workflows, and GitHub Actions.Bonus Skills:
Experience deploying apps to the Play Store and App Store.Exposure to Mobile Configuration Profiles (MCP).Previous work on betting or real-time interactive apps.Other Requirements:
Able to work independently in a fast-moving environment with minimal supervision.Comfortable collaborating remotely with designers, engineers, and stakeholders.The Ideal CandidateYou’re a self-motivated mobile developer who enjoys building high-quality, user-centered apps from scratch. You're fluent in modern mobile development best practices and comfortable owning the full stack—from real-time data integration to pixel-perfect UI. You’re curious about new tools and excited to push the boundaries of what’s possible with React Native.Seniority levelSeniority levelEntry levelEmployment typeEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionJob functionEngineering and Information TechnologyIndustriesTechnology, Information and InternetReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at Braintrust by 2xSign in to set job alerts for “Mobile Engineer” roles.Software Engineer, Mobile (Swift/Kotlin)Staff Software Engineer, Mobile SDK (Android & iOS)We’re unlocking community knowledge in a new way. Experts add insights directly into each article, started with the help of AI.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Iot Engineer (Aws)
description:
Na act digital, aceleramos a transformação digital de grandes empresas por meio de soluções tecnológicas sob medida. Como parte da nossa parceria com um cliente global AWS Advanced Tier Services Partner, buscamos um(a) IoT Engineer altamente técnico(a) e apaixonado(a) por inovação em nuvem. Se você domina o ecossistema AWS IoT e quer impactar projetos de alto nível com grandes empresas dos setores de tecnologia, saúde e finanças, essa vaga é para você!Responsabilidades :
Participar de discussões técnicas e estratégicas com clientes para entender requisitos e objetivos de negócio.Colaborar com arquitetos na definição e desenho de soluções IoT.Implementar e integrar funcionalidades com os principais serviços da AWS IoT.Garantir segurança, performance e escalabilidade das soluções.Participar da construção de ambientes com CI / CD e boas práticas DevOps.Requisitos :
4 anos de experiência com soluções IoT em nuvem.Sólido domínio de serviços AWS como IoT Core, Device Management, Greengrass, Analytics, Timestream, entre outros.Conhecimento de protocolos como MQTT, dispositivos edge e estruturas de payload.Experiência com APIs REST, pipelines CI / CD e segurança em ambientes conectados.Inglês avançado (leitura, escrita e conversação).Certificações AWS.Experiência com Lambda, API Gateway, CloudFormation ou Terraform.Atuação prévia com projetos serverless e IoT em escala.Somos uma empresa global de tecnologia com presença em mais de 10 países, especializada em escalar produtos digitais, modernizar plataformas e desenvolver talentos estratégicos. Acreditamos na tecnologia como motor de impacto real e criamos soluções que transformam negócios com agilidade, inovação e profundidade técnica. Se você quer trabalhar com um time de ponta, em projetos desafiadores e com liberdade para inovar, venha criar o futuro com a gente.Criar um alerta de emprego para esta pesquisaEngineer - são gonçalo, estado do rio de janeiro, br#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Openstack Engineering Manager
description:
Join or sign in to find your next jobJoin to apply for the OpenStack Engineering Manager role at Canonical1 week ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the OpenStack Engineering Manager role at CanonicalCanonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.We are hiring an Engineering Manager ...This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you'll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a Cloud Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.Location:
This is a globally remote role.The role entailsManage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operationsIdentify and measure team health indicatorsImplement disciplined engineering and operations processesRepresent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teamsEnsure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverablesWork to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globeDeliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely mannerWhat we are looking for in youBachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology fieldProven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teamsProven experience with OpenStackDemonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code qualityExperience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plusStrong communication and cooperation skillsExperience with agile software development methodologiesExperience working in and managing distributed teamsTechnical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systemsExperience with cloud topologies and technologiesTravel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or lessWhat we offer colleaguesWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in personPersonal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per yearAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveMaternity and paternity leaveTeam Member Assistance Program & Wellness PlatformOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleaguesPriority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence;
in order to succeed, weneed to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.Seniority levelSeniority levelMid-Senior levelEmployment typeEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionJob functionEngineering and Information TechnologyIndustriesSoftware DevelopmentReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at Canonical by 2xEngineering Manager - Solutions EngineeringTechnical Manager - Automotive and IndustrialSoftware Engineering Manager - Sustaining EngineeringSoftware Engineering Manager (Backend SaaS)Engineering Manager - Public Cloud, Python, GolangSoftware Engineering Manager, Ubuntu GamingEmbedded Linux Field Engineering ManagerEngineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management)Software Platform Engineering Manager - Ubuntu for Next-Gen SiliconLinux Engineering Manager - Optimisation for Latest HardwareSoftware Engineering Manager - Desktop and Embedded Linux OptimisationEngineering Manager, Ubuntu Server - Ubuntu ProSoftware Engineering Manager - Container and Virtualisation InfrastructureSoftware Engineering Manager - Ubuntu Linux KernelWe’re unlocking community knowledge in a new way. title: Profissional De Engenharia Mlops - Sr
description:
Código da vaga:
47540Sobre a BRQ DigitalHá 32 anos no mercado, a BRQ Digital Solutions se consolidou como uma das maiores empresas de transformação digital do país. Com uma plataforma de serviços end to end, oferecemos as mais eficientes e inovadoras soluções, tecnologias e metodologias, promovendo uma jornada de transformação para grandes marcas, de diferentes segmentos, no Brasil e no exterior.Nossos 2.500 mil funcionários atuam no modelo de trabalho Anywhere Office e a empresa é destaque como um dos melhores lugares para trabalhar pelo GPTW e Glassdoor.BRQ WAYNo nosso BRQ WAY temos a missão de conectar, transformar e empoderar cada um dos nossos profissionais, que por aqui são chamados de feras, para que todos tenham a chance de usar sua paixão para transformar o mundo com tecnologia!É isso que queremos, com nosso Programa de Diversidade e Inclusão trabalhamos com dois objetivos:
equidade e inclusão, buscamos aumentar a participação dos grupos minoritários, quebrar os vieses inconscientes e expandir a conscientização sobre temas tão importantes para que todos sejam livres para serem quem são.Vamos transformar juntos! Vem ser fera com a gente.Ei Profissional de Engenharia MlOps - SR, chegou o momento de encarar um novo desafio em sua carreira! Venha ser um #ferabrq- O que procuramos?Buscamos um #fera com espírito empreendedor e que sabe que é o verdadeiro protagonista do seu sucesso! Queremos em nosso time pessoas motivadas por desafios, constante evolução e, claro, que são apaixonadas por tecnologia e transformação!- O que você deve ter?Habilidades Principais:
Experiência com MLOps e Engenharia de Machine Learning - Vivência no desenvolvimento e manutenção de pipelines de ML em ambientes produtivos, utilizando ferramentas como Airflow, MLflow, entre outras.Programação e Automação - Sólidos conhecimentos em Python e Bash, com foco em automação de tarefas e integração de workflows de ML.Conhecimento em Ciência de Dados e Machine Learning - Entendimento de conceitos, práticas e aplicações de modelos preditivos, incluindo preparação, treinamento e deploy de modelos.Versionamento e Experimentação de Modelos - Experiência com controle de versões e rastreamento de experimentos (DVC, MLflow, Metaflow).Integração Contínua e Entrega Contínua (CI/CD) - Prática com ferramentas como GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, e aplicação de boas práticas DevOps no ciclo de vida dos modelos.Diferenciais:
Conhecimento em infraestrutura como código (Terraform, CloudFormation, CDK).Experiência com ferramentas de explicabilidade de modelos.- O que temos pra te oferecer?Mais do que um plano de carreira!A BRQ acredita que cada fera deve ser protagonista do seu crescimento, tendo autonomia para criar seu próprio plano de desenvolvimento profissional. Nosso plano de carreira é dividido em 4 pilares:
Carreira técnica:
Você pode seguir a trilha de crescimento técnico, se o seu objetivo for se desenvolver cada vez mais em diferentes tecnologias. Oferecemos diversos treinamentos!Carreira de Liderança:
Você pode seguir a trilha e se tornar um líder, desenvolver pessoas, auxiliar na evolução profissional e pessoal e estimular o crescimento para o surgimento de novos talentos.Experiência internacional:
Estamos crescendo cada vez mais fora do Brasil e você tem possibilidade de atuar em projetos para outros países, ou diretamente nos países onde a BRQ tem sede.Empreendedorismo:
De funcionário para sócio! Temos o Innovation Hub, a Corporate Venture que investe em ideias de profissionais que tenham sinergia com nosso negócio.- E os benefícios?Plano de Saúde;
Plano Odontológico;
Seguro de Vida;
Vale Refeição;
Vale Alimentação;
Horário Flexível;
Atuação híbrida;
Gympass, Telemedicina,Telenutrição, Canal de suporte emocional 24h e muito mais!- Como é trabalhar na BRQ?Temos um clima descontraído, diversos programas e eventos internos. Adoramos comemorar! E fazemos isso muito bem! Veja aqui no Youtube:
youtube.Com/brqdigitalsolutionsCurtiu? Então inscreva-se e venha para o melhor da Transformação Digital com a gente!

title: Engenheiro De Desenvolvimento De Projetos De Engenharia Iii - Eletrobras - Rio De Janeiro / Rj
description:
Engenheiro de Desenvolvimento de Projetos de Engenharia III - Eletrobras - Rio de Janeiro / RJSomos a Eletrobras, empresa líder em geração e transmissão de energia elétrica no Brasil e na América Latina. Por meio de nossos ativos, contribuímos para que a matriz energética brasileira seja uma das mais limpas e renováveis do mundo. Alinhados à nossa Cultura e Propósito, trabalhamos de forma integrada para contribuir com o desenvolvimento sustentável que gere valor para toda a sociedade.Se você quer fazer parte da nossa companhia e se tornar um de nossos talentos, saiba que estamos com uma oportunidade em aberto para Engenheiro de Desenvolvimento de Projetos de Engenharia III. Esse profissional desempenhará sua função na Eletrobras, localizada em Rio de Janeiro / RJ, em modelo presencial.Ah, não se esqueça de conferir abaixo as etapas do processo do seletivo.Com o seu talento podemos ir ainda mais longe, sempre guiados pelo nosso propósito de cuidar do planeta entregando a energia em que a gente acredita.Vem com a gente, junte-se à Nossa Energia!Responsabilidades e Atribuições:
Apoiar e desenvolver equipes internas e terceirizadas soluções para projetos de sistemas digitais de supervisão e controle (SDSC);
Desenvolver projeto e soluções de indústria 4.0 aplicadas aos Sistemas Digitais de Supervisão e Controle (SDSC) de geração em escala de rede, elaborando layouts conceituais, diagramas unifilares e apoiando o detalhamento do projeto, desde a arquitetura de controle e proteção até a integração ao sistema de supervisão (SCADA);
Estabelecer topologia de comunicações com integração de equipamentos de automação a interfaces com usuários através de protocolos de comunicação para SDSC e aplicações de internet das coisas (IOT e MQTT), disponibilizando dados através de plataformas WEB (APIs);
Elaborar arquiteturas de rede de sistemas de supervisão em cloud computing AWS, considerando medidas de segurança da informação (VPN e firewall);
Acompanhar testes de ensaio de rotina e teste de comissionamento de SDSC;
Avaliar tecnologias, produtos e fornecedores de SDSC, suportando a implementação de novas tecnologia e a seleção de fornecedores;
Desenvolver relatórios técnicos escritos que transmitam conceitos de sistemas, casos de uso e apoiar resultados de estudos de viabilidade para um pipeline;
Executar o desenvolvimento de planos de engenharia, especificações técnicas, estimativas de custo e documentos de construção de marcos de projeto para projetos de SDSC;
Apoiar pipelinena identificação, definição e implementação de casos de uso para Sistemas de Geração em locais centralizados e/ou distribuídos;
Dar suportetécnico aos projetos de SDSC, para:
Elaboração de croquis e projetos preliminares, quando necessário;
Desenvolver novos padrões tecnológicos com o objetivo de enriquecer as especificações técnicas da ELETROBRAS;
Elaboração e atualização de Especificações Técnicas (ETs), Termo de Referencias e Projetos Básicos;
Desenvolvimentode equipamentos, sistemas e fornecedores;
desenvolvimentoe análise de Workstatement do SDSCElaboração de Estudos Executivos;
Elaboração de parecer técnico sobre equipamentos e sistemas;
Testes de Aceite em Fábrica (TAF);
Comissionamentoe Testesde Aceite em Campo (TAC).Participar da prospecção e avaliação de novos projetos em SDSC em geração de energia, incluindo fusões e aquisições (M&A), avaliando oportunidades de investimento e propondo soluções técnicas inovadoras;
Representar a empresa em reuniões técnicas com fornecedores, órgãos reguladores e outras partes interessadas, defendendo os interesses da empresa e buscando soluções colaborativas para assuntos técnicos de sua atribuição.Requisitos e Qualificações:
- Registro ativo no CREA;
- Formação superior completa em Engenharia Elétrica, Eletrônica, Automação ou Mecatrônica;
- Autonomia, comunicação, capacidade de solucionar problemas.Na Eletrobras, o bem-estar e a qualidade de vida dos nossos profissionais também fazem parte da Nossa Energia. Por isso, estamos empenhados em oferecer um ambiente de trabalho que valorize o equilíbrio entre vida pessoal e profissional, disponibilizando benefícios que promovem o bem-estar, o desenvolvimento e o atendimento às necessidades dos nossos times. Alguns dos benefícios que disponibilizamos estão disponíveis abaixo:
- Alimentação:
Vale-refeição e vale-alimentação;
- Plano Médico e Odontológico;
- Seguro de Vida;
- Previdência Privada;
- Auxílio educacional;
- Universidade corporativa interna que contribui com a aprendizagem diária dos profissionaisSe esses benefícios e essa posição fazem sentido para você, inscreva-se já!Step 4:
Avaliação Psicológica 4 Avaliação PsicológicaCuidamos do planeta entregando a energia em que a gente acreditaSomos a Eletrobras, empresa líder em geração e transmissão de energia elétrica no Brasil e na América Latina. Por meio de nossos ativos, contribuímos para que a matriz energética brasileira seja uma das mais limpas e renováveis do mundo.Alinhados à nossa Cultura e Propósito, trabalhamos de forma integrada para contribuir com o desenvolvimento sustentável que gere valor para toda a sociedade. Com capacidade instalada de 44.6 GW, estamos presentes em todas as regiões do país e somos referência em uma energia de baixo carbono.Há mais de seis décadas, nascemos para gerar energia. Uma energia que nos conecta, inova, transforma, integra e contribui com o amanhã. Somos comprometidos com a vida. Oferecemos um ambiente seguro, íntegro, respeitoso e inclusivo, que promove oportunidades contínuas de desenvolvimento aos profissionais em sinergia com o nosso negócio.Venha fazer parte da Nossa Energia. Venha ser Eletrobras!ACESSE OS NOSSOS CANAIS E FIQUE POR DENTRO DE TUDO O QUE ACONTECE NA ELETROBRAS#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Engenheiro De Automação E Inteligência Artificial Sênior (Clt) | Remoto
description:
Estamos em busca de uma pessoa Engenheira Sênior altamente capacitada para integrar nossa equipe e atuar como referência técnica em Machine Learning (ML), IA Generativa e Automação. Esta é uma oportunidade para profissionais que desejam ir além, moldar o futuro dos nossos produtos e desbloquear o potencial de um time remoto, autônomo e vibrante.Você chegará em um momento crucial da empresa, onde a experiência em lidar com sistemas em evolução e a capacidade de inovar em um ambiente cloud-centric (AWS) são diferenciais.Acreditamos em um senso de grupo forte e na autonomia das equipes para entregar valor.O Gran é um ecossistema que une educação e tecnologia, que acelera e customiza o aprendizado para diferentes necessidades e momentos e que já impactou mais de 2 milhões de vidas. Temos a plataforma de educação mais acessada do Brasil e fomos eleitos a 5ª empresa mais inovadora da América Latina. Hoje, temos 2 verticais principais:
a de Cursos Preparatórios e a Gran Faculdade.Adotamos iniciativas tecnológicas para deixar a educação mais inclusiva. Por isso, temos atualmente vários produtos para fazer isso acontecer, como:
os audiolivros – com técnicas avançadas de inteligência artificial, criamos um acervo com mais de 28 mil livros convertidos em 110 mil horas de áudio –;
o Gerenciador de Estudos, que auxilia no planejamento diário;
e os aplicativos para TV e celulares Android e iOS, que funcionam também no modo offline.Recursos tecnológicos e inovação nos acompanham desde sempre e, com o esforço do nosso time, fomos reconhecidos mundialmente pela Amazon Web Services com três cases de sucesso envolvendo Inteligência Artificial, boas práticas, inovação, inclusão e impacto. Acesse nossos cases clicando nos links abaixo:
➡ 20 mil horas de vídeo legendadas com mais de 92% de precisão;
➡ Recomendação decursosutilizando Amazon SageMaker;
➡ Audiolivros.Se interessou? Vem ser GranLover!Esta vaga está no nosso modelo de trabalho Gran Mundo, sendo 100% remoto.Todas as nossas vagas são no modelo de trabalho CLT.Quer saber mais sobre a gente? Clique AQUI para retornar para a página de carreiras.Responsabilidades e atribuições

title: Engenheiro Telecomunicações Sr - Rha 1524 (Duque Decaxias)
description:
Quer saber mais sobre a gente e fazer parte do time que está construindo o futuro?Transformando o mundo com tecnologiaSomos quase 2.000 Spreaders, espalhados em 22 estados brasileiros através do Spread Anywhere, que nos permite trabalhar de forma 100% remota, dependendo do modelo de contrato. Somos digitais, hiperconectados e de onde estivermos colocamos em prática todos os dias um dos valores tão presentes na nossa cultura, que é a #colaboração.Inovação para desenvolver o futuroSomos uma empresa de tecnologia com 39 anos de experiência, evolução e uma grande bagagem de conhecimento em diferentes frentes, da infraestrutura com Serviços Gerenciados de TI e de Telecomunicações, passando pela nossa camada de software com Desenvolvimento Ágil, SAP, Salesforce e Testes de Qualidade, até a nossa camada digital, com Automação, Event Mesh, Big Data e Squad Gerenciada.Diversidade, Equidade & InclusãoAqui a diversidade e inclusão não é apenas uma palavra, mas sim um compromisso genuíno. Trabalhamos para fazer com que todas as pessoas Spreaders se sintam valorizadas, respeitadas e capacitadas para alcançar o pleno potencial. Reconhecemos que a verdadeira diversidade vai além de questões superficiais e abrange uma ampla gama de características, como gênero, etnia, orientação sexual, idade e habilidades.Respiramos a Cultura da Agilidade, apoiados pela filosofia Lean. Com isso, temos uma metodologia própria para adoção, aprimoramento e propagação de métodos ágeis, que é o SPREAD BUSINESS AGILITY, que visa melhorar o nosso entendimento sobre os desafios dos clientes, acelerar o desenvolvimento das nossas pessoas e estabelecer um novo modelo de crescimento do nosso negócio.Requisitos:
3 anos de experiência nos serviçosResponsabilidades:
Garantir o controle e a execução das manutenções conforme plano de manutenção e procedimentos aplicáveis;
Providenciar tratamentopara as não conformidades que forem identificadas;
Participar de reuniões operacionais periódicas;
Consolidar e fornecer dados solicitados pela Gestão da Manutenção;
Medir, monitorar e apresentar indicadores e itens de verificação de manutenção da AG de acordo com os prazos determinados pela PETROBRAS;
Outras atividades inerentes ao papel.Crie um alerta de emprego para esta vagaEngenheiro - Duque de Caxias, Rio de Janeiro, Brasil#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: R&D Engineer (Advanced Drilling Systems)
description:
Our client is expanding its R&D team in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and is seeking highly motivated engineers to contribute to the development of cutting-edge drilling technologies for offshore deepwater applications. This opportunity centers on innovation, new product development, and testing—not operations or maintenance.We are hiring across multiple disciplines to support core technology areas including downhole power generation, coiled tubing/drillstring development, subsea and high-voltage electronics, and advanced testing/integration systems. Ideal candidates will have a solid background in research and development (R&D), system design, and engineering analysis, with hands-on experience in product development for high-reliability environments.Areas of Expertise We’re Looking For:
Mechanical Engineering:
Experience in drilling motors, downhole turbines, or subsea pumps for power generation;
coiled tubing/drillstring development;
familiarity with manufacturing, machining, and supplier coordination.Mechanical Design/Drafting:
Proficiency in generating manufacturing drawings for complex drilling or subsea components and coordinating with manufacturers/suppliers.Integration/Test Engineering:
Engineers with a mechanical or electrical/electronics focus, experienced in downhole or subsea systems, sensor integration, test equipment design, and data acquisition.Electrical Engineering:
Plasma/High-Voltage Electronics:
High-voltage systems for plasma-based drilling. Relevant experience in military, defense, pulsed power, lasers, or nuclear sectors is a plus.Subsea/Downhole Electronics:
Development of high-power electronics and embedded systems for subsea applications.Software/Firmware/Controls Engineering:
Firmware Development:
Development and validation of high-reliability firmware for oil & gas environments.Controls Engineering:
Experience with PLC programming, real-time control systems, test equipment design, and HIL testing. Familiarity with MATLAB, dSPACE, or SPEEDGOAT is advantageous.Key ResponsibilitiesExecute R&D projects in alignment with technical specifications, timelines, and budgetDesign, test, and commercialize innovative drilling tools and systems for offshore useImplement processes and tools that drive excellence and innovation in product developmentCollaborate with global engineering teams, leadership, and suppliers to ensure successful integration and deliveryManage technical risks and ensure compliance with HSEQ and regulatory standardsProduce detailed engineering documentation including drawings, calculations, and technical reportsFoster a culture of collaboration and innovation within the R&D teamRepresent the company’s technical work at conferences to reinforce its position as a technology leaderOur client is growing its footprint in Brazil to address the region’s unique energy challenges. With a focus on offshore and deepwater solutions, the local team is instrumental in developing next-generation drilling systems tailored to this critical market. They work in close partnership with global collaborators and local operators to bring advanced solutions to life.In this role, you’ll engage in transformative R&D efforts alongside teams in Brazil, Europe, and the USA—contributing to innovations across both conventional and renewable energy domains.

description:
Job DescriptionAbout youWe are looking for an experienced QA Performance Engineer responsible for planning, implementing and monitoring quality assurance strategies and procedures to give our clients the best service to ensure the non-functional requirements for performance are met.You bring to Applaudo the following competencies:
4 years (minimum) as a QA analyst.Experience with Azure services and distributed systemsKnowledge of performance testing and proven experience developing automated test cases using JMeter, LoadRunner, NeoLoad, etc.Understanding of REST APIs and network performance conceptsKnowledge of Azure Monitor, App Insights, Grafana.Scripting with Python, PowerShell, or JavaScript.Version control (e.G., Git) and CI/CD integration.Experience with SQL Server profilingKnowledge of automation and agile methodologies (SCRUM).Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Fast paced learning and collaborative mindsetStrong written and oral communication skills in English are mandatory, as you will be working directly with US-based clients.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.You will be accountable for the following responsibilities:
